attributes.action: Introduce a requirement for address verification for internet applications
attributes.background: We've got to get real regarding issues with Bots and third-party actors on social networks and other internet applications. The hate and anger we are seeing online must be stopped and one of the only tools we have to do so is to make people prove who they say they are.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am proposing is this...

Any application designed for access by the general public and allowing internal messaging or commenting or any other intra-user communication must verify the postal address of users.

All applications to either filter out un-verified users by default or provide a mechanism to allow users to opt-in and opt-out of receiving messages from un-verified users. 

All existing application users to be subject to the same verification procedure within a time limit.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: 5 year driving ban for speads in excess of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.background: A driver who speeds excessively is aware of their actions. Therefore an immediate ban of 5years should be given to those driving in excess  of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are killed each year by speeding drivers. If those drivers were told if they speed more than 10mph over the specified limit they would be banned from driving for 5 years. We would have a lot of people asking themselves is it rely worth the risk of 5 year  instant ban.

attributes.action: Make it an offense for essay writing services to advertise to under 16's
attributes.background: In the same way that gambling, alcohol and cigarettes are prohibited from advertising to minors, I suggest similar measures be applied to companies like UK Essays and other Essay Mills in order to protect minors from being unduly influenced by manipulative marketing practices.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds take their CBT once they reach their final school year
attributes.background: When you're 16, you can take your cbt, ride a motorcycle, buy energy drinks, and get a job, however a 15 year old in the same school year can’t do any of these things. How come you're mature enough to be in the same school year, but not to have any of the perks?
attributes.additional_details: I found it especially frustrating, having a birthday in August, I had to see teenagers, who were in the same school year and learning the same as me ride motorbikes, and get jobs, while I was stuck in a village with no transport, a friend of mine in the same school year had a motorbike and had no issue, for instance, I could have been doing motorvehicle as an apprenticeship, but not be able to get a licence until after someone who’s never driven before, even though their the same year

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Make snow days in school a legal requirement when snowfall is over 2 inches.
attributes.background: I believe that england doesn't see much snow and when it does the children in schools need time to appreciate it. Maybe they could dabble in winter sports or just have a simple snowball fight. It can als be dangerous to get children to school as the roads will become icy and dangerous for driving.

attributes.action: Stop change 4 life's campaign on healthy eating and lifestyle
attributes.background: Change 4 life's campaign for a healthy lifestyle is supposedly trying to help children. However, exposing nutritional values to children or such young ages can become a main cause of developing an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details:
Children and young adolescents should be able to enjoy a carefree childhood without the pressure of obsessing over the things they eat. Everything in moderation is healthy and children should be encouraged to believe this. Eating disorders are on the rise but yet this campaign is still choosing to fuel them and ignore the high mortality rate
 as a result of these illness'.

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.

attributes.action: Examine Greybull's actions in respect of insolvency of Monarch Airline/Holidays.
attributes.background: Monarch ceased trading on Monday 2 October 2017, leaving 2,000 employees without jobs and 860,000 passengers without flights. This is Greybull’s third venture that has failed and the largest failure in British aviation history.
attributes.additional_details: We question the entire involvement of Greybull Capital in respect of Monarch. From reports it would appear that both prior and post insolvency the UK Government have pumped millions of pounds into Greybull Capital and although Greybull state they have lost out in excess of £100 million it is reported that Monarch had £48 million in the bank and aircraft take off and landing slots will be worth at least £60 million to Greybull. These figures alone equate to greater than £100 million.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Protection for WW2 RN wrecks that are being blown up & the sailors desecrated
attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below

attributes.action: Introduce a Free Speech Act and end hate speech laws in the UK
attributes.background: We should have a law protecting the right to free speech like the USA. It should also repeal laws on hate speech and prevent people being arrested for jokes or offending someone.

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Automatic general election on change in the leadership of the governing party.
attributes.background: Given the substantial change in the character of a political party on changing its leadership, it seems undemocratic for the mandate from a general election to automatically transfer to a new leader with potentially completely different policies without consulting the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: The law should be changed to require a General Election if the leadership of the governing party changes.

attributes.action: Make smoking while driving illegal
attributes.background: The amount of people that have been killed in forest fires or road traffic collisions is astounding. This is all because someone throws their cigarette butt out of the window of the car. Or is not focusing while driving. I.e trying to light a cigarette.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make black plastic illegal
attributes.background: Currently in the UK only a third of plastic can be recycled. The public have been placing their plastic in the green bins completely unawares that most will end in landfill or incinerated. One of the quickest ways the Government can reduce this is to ban black plastic packaging.
attributes.additional_details: This featured as a main story on the BBC news on the 4th of August 2018.

attributes.action: Financial incentives for households without a vehicle.
attributes.background: Financial incentives on vehicle free households will reduce air pollution and congestion. It will also reduce poverty, as it will benefit a higher proportion of people on lower incomes initially.

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: Ban Online Casinos
attributes.background: Online casinos cause misery for the user and their families and friends.This is an addictive gambling machine and not a fun way to waste peoples money. Ban all online and shop based slot machines.

attributes.action: Hot weather payment to stay cool
attributes.background: Emergency payment for those in need to keep cool in such extreme heat
attributes.additional_details: Cold weather payments are made so people don't die of cold but a person can die of heat stroke just as much

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: Ban fake numbers being used for sales, marketing, PPI and personal injury calls.
attributes.background:
We frequently receive calls about that 'accident' we've had or about that PPI claim we could make.

Companies use a fake number, so that you have no way of tracing where the call from and so they are unaccountable.  

I propose that UK phone networks apply technology to block such calls.

attributes.action: Prevent those in Public Service from withholding data
attributes.background: Data laws are being used to cover up & block complaints. Organisations and public bodies should have to prove in court that a request is vexatious before they can refuse to give information. The ICO should be given the funds and powers to fully investigate non-compliance with the law.
attributes.additional_details: Those who don't fully comply with a request in 1 calendar month must be fined. The impact on those who suffer failure, abuse and hostility is worse if they can't access all their records to pursue a complaint. It affects the most vulnerable, those on low incomes who may not be able to access public services e.g. housing, disabled facilities, innocent children forced out of school, school bullying covered up that may lead to children self-harming or children/individuals targeted by authorities.

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Adopt the STV voting system for a more representative government.
attributes.background: Our current FPTP voting system is extremely flawed. The system has been in use for so long that, just like the USA, we are stuck in a two-party system that we will never be able to break out of.
attributes.additional_details:
Let’s imagine a new country adopts the system and holds the first election. The results are-
Blue- 27% of votes 
Green-32% of votes
Red-21% of votes
Yellow-20% of votes.
Green party wins with only 32% of the country’s representatives but is elected PM (68% of the country is unrepresented).
This is the system we have in the UK. 
I don’t have enough characters left to explain the benefits of STV, but please use these videos to learn-
https://youtu.be/P38Y4VG1Ibo
https://youtu.be/l8XOZJkozfI

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: Launch an awareness campaign for the causes and symptoms of skin cancer
attributes.background: Last year I had Melanoma and there was little awareness out there, there is more than 1 type of skin cancer. I feel that there is little awareness out there about them and about damage the sun/sun beds can do. There needs to be more campaigns to help prevent it.

attributes.action: Introduce Stronger Legislation Governing The Sale of Animal Grooming Products.
attributes.background: At present, companies that produce cosmetic products for animals are under no legal compulsion to label their products appropriately or adhere to the safety standards that regulate the sale of human cosmetics. We want the UK Government to address this with the introduction of stronger legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation affecting the sale of pet products is currently encompassed by EU Cosmetic Regulation 1223/2009 and Section 7.7 (a) of Regulation (EC) No 648/2004 on detergents (European Union, 2009) which states there is no 'sector specific' legislation governing the sale of pet grooming products. We believe the UK can lead the world in introducing stronger legislation forcing a reappraisal in the way in which these products are regulated and labelled.

attributes.action: At 17 you should be able to ride atleast a 250Cc superbike / Pitbike ( Crosser )
attributes.background:
At 17 you're legally allowed to ride a 125Cc. (75 MPH max ).        
So instead make it so you can ride a 250 Cc.
